snippet: Ahmad Bradshaw’s last-minute touchdown was a result of a Patriots strategy that ultimately failed.
abstract: New York Giants running back Ahmad Bradshaw scores the Super Bowl's game-winning touchdown when his momentum carries him backwards into the end zone; Bradshaw had intended to stop short of the goal line as part of a time management strategy to keep the Patriots from getting the ball with enough time to execute a comeback.
lead_paragraph: Ahmad Bradshaw’s last-minute touchdown was a result of a Patriots strategy that ultimately failed.

headline.seo: Super Bowl — Bradshaw Backs Into a Victory
